prompt: Create a website for a professional maritime navigation service. Use a deep navy blue for the main color.
code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Maritime Navigation Services</title>
    <style>
        :root {
            --primary-navy: #001F3F; /* Deep Navy Blue */
            --light-accent: #ADD8E6; /* Light Blue */
            --white-text: #FFFFFF;
            --dark-text: #333333;
            --light-bg: #F0F8FF; /* Alice Blue */
        }

        body {
            font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            line-height: 1.6;
            color: var(--dark-text);
            background-color: var(--light-bg);
        }

        header {
            background-color: var(--primary-navy);
            color: var(--white-text);
            padding: 1rem 2rem;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-between;
            align-items: center;
            box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
        }

        header .logo {
            font-size: 1.8rem;
            font-weight: bold;
            color: var(--white-text);
            text-decoration: none;
        }

        nav a {
            color: var(--white-text);
            text-decoration: none;
            margin-left: 20px;
            font-weight: 500;
            transition: color 0.3s ease;
        }

            color: var(--light-accent);
